message.content:
cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the study of low degree Boolean functions and their approximation by juntas, which are a well-studied concept in computational complexity theory and information theory. The paper also introduces a new class of functions called sparse juntas, which are a natural extension of juntas. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), and cs.CG (Computational Geometry), as these sub-categories are closely related to the topics discussed in the paper.
